definition: Silkworms in Spring (1933), Chinese silent movie in socialist realist style, based on novel by Mao Dun 茅盾[Mao2 Dun4]

sentences.english: The duration of high humidity lasted much longer in spring than that in summer.
sentences.chinese: 春蠶期高溼的持續時間長於夏蠶期。

sentences.english: Life is like a spring silkworm cocoon, since bound up, once eyebrow feather, drill into the also in me.
sentences.chinese: 人生如春蠶，作繭自纏裹，一朝眉羽成，鑽破亦在我。

sentences.english: The silk sacrifice themselves to produce silk which keepd people warm.
sentences.chinese: 春蠶用自己的生命吐出細細的蠶絲，爲人們帶來溫暖。

sentences.english: As spring gave the lifetime loyalty.
sentences.chinese: 就象那春蠶獻出一生的忠誠。

sentences.english: So, you learn spirit, so that put a beautiful tapestry of the motherland.
sentences.chinese: 於是，你把春蠶的精神汲取，讓祖國披上美麗的織錦。

sentences.english: The teacher is the silkworm, the last thread and self.
sentences.chinese: 老師是春蠶，吐儘自我最後一根絲線。

definition: to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
lit. as round as pearls and as smooth as jade (idiom)/fig. elegant and polished (of singing or writing)
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
